match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 7 wickets (with 47 balls remaining)

dismissalComment.html: chops this one onto the stumps. Bangladesh on fire at the moment. Almost had him LBW just a couple of balls ago, and now gets Masakadza to mistime an attempted drive completely. Bangladesh couldn't have asked for a better start.

dismissalText.commentary: Cephas Zhuwao b Mohammad Saifuddin 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: GONE. Straight ball again, and he swings across the line without any footwork. Just clips the top of off-stump, and then there's Saifuddin's celebration where he thumps his chest.

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor run out (Ariful Haque) 28 (21b 0x4 2x6) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: a high full toss but Williams fails to take advantage of it, ends up skying it towards long-on, falls short of the fielder but a direct at the non-striker's end results in a run-out. Moor put in the dive but was well short

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Tiripano b H Masakadza 117 (92b 9x4 6x6) SR: 127.17

dismissalComment.html: finally gets one wrong, looks to clear long-on but couldn't get under the ball completely and the long-on takes a good overhead catch tumbling on his back

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Chigumbura b WP Masakadza 115 (112b 10x4 2x6) SR: 102.67

dismissalComment.html: ah, Kayes has holed out.. looking for the glorious finish. Wasn't needed but he was set and looking for a big hit or two. Advances down the ground and carts this over mid-off but as he does so the bat turns in his hands and the ball settles into the hands of long-off
finally gets one wrong, looks to clear long-on but couldn't get under the ball completely and the long-on takes a good overhead catch tumbling on his back

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das lbw b Jarvis 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: raps the pad straight away! Huge shout for lbw, given, but this seemed like it was heading down leg. Review promptly taken. Full, angling in, tries to flick and the ball misses the inside edge. Nothing on Ultra Edge. Umpire's call.. Clipping outside of leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: is that the game? Yes, it is. That has carried for six. Short, straightening around off, Mushfiqur rocks back and pulls over deep midwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.55pm I don't remember the last time Bangladesh were this clinical. Very often, they have belligerent starts, then slow down through the middle, largely due to failure to rotate the strike, then slog and lose wickets, and end up limping over the line, usually with Shakib or another veteran helping them over. But there was none of that today. No Shakib. No middle-overs meltdown. No scraping through. Just a thoroughly dominant performance, thrashing a Zimbabwe side with some unbelievable hitting. They lost Liton early, but once Imrul and Soumya settled in, they never looked back. They were relentless in their hitting, finding the boundary with effortless frequency and mowing the target down. Zimbabwe had their own heroes in Sean Williams and Brendan Taylor, but it was nowhere enough to stop them getting overpowered by Bangladesh's batting might.
Ahnaf Tahmid: "Back to back two matches won by hitting a SIX !! Shows you how dominant Bangladesh have been in this last 2 matches."

"We had a good outing with the bat," says Hamilton Masakadza. "We thought we had a good score, but the second-wicket partnership took the game away from us. Different mindset in the Tests, a few of the guys got some runs on the board, and hopefully we can carry that confidence."

Soumya Sarkar is Man of the Match. He says he's very pleased to play this innings. He's been out of the team for some time, so that innings felt good. It was a batting-friendly pitch, and he took an opportune moment to play a big innings.

Imrul kayes is Man of the Series. Highest run-tally in a three-match series for Bangladesh. "It's been a great series for me. I tried my best and wanted to do something better and something different. Soumya is a positive player. He's a class batsman. My pressure was released by him. I will try my best in the Test series as well."

"Coming back from Asia Cup, we had a lot of confidence," says Mashrafe Motaza. "Our bowling needs to improve, even from my side. We lost some rhythm, but we did alright. The bowlers did well, even with the inexperience, we restricted them to 285, which was a good effort. Soumya and Imrul played with lot of calm. I hope our Test team will do well."

Zimbabwe's horrid time in ODIs continues with yet another clean sweep. Can they salvage something in the Tests? They have some time to empty this bag and come out fresh. FOr now, this is all we have. Hop onto the T20I between Pakistan and Australia if your appetite for cricket isn't satiated yet. From Hemant, Debayan and myself, it's goodbye.

commentTextItems.html: full toss, angled into him, shovels it straight over mid-on.. one-bounce over the boundary

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full toss, driven to extra cover
gets forward and blocks a length ball
advances down the ground and tries to heave this slider over the on side, rolls along to deep midwicket off the inside part of the bat
loops it up on middle, waits and blocks to point
tucks a length ball to midwicket
drops this to point and skips down for a run but is sent back

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: good length on middle, front-foot defense
length ball on middle and leg, defended
pushes a fuller ball to long-off
advances down the ground and blocks to cover

commentPreTextItems.html: RJ Mahfuj: "Well Played Kayes ! Welcome to the sweet problem of picking one from three for the opening stand with Tamim ! My choice: Tamim & Kayes at the opening. Soumya and Liton, choose one for 3 or 7."

commentTextItems.html: backs away and punches through the covers to the right of the sweeper
blocks a fuller one off the inside of the bat

commentTextItems.html: dropped. Tries to force a cut with the ball not turning as much, not enough room, gets an outside edge that's shelled by the keeper. Very tough chance

pitched up on middle, flicked to midwicket
taps a fuller one on the front foot to cover for a quick one
opens the face to third man

dismissalComment.html: raps the pad straight away! Huge shout for lbw, given, but this seemed like it was heading down leg. Review promptly taken. Full, angling in, tries to flick and the ball misses the inside edge. Nothing on Ultra Edge. Umpire's call.. Clipping outside of leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: ah, Kayes has holed out.. looking for the glorious finish. Wasn't needed but he was set and looking for a big hit or two. Advances down the ground and carts this over mid-off but as he does so the bat turns in his hands and the ball settles into the hands of long-off
finally gets one wrong, looks to clear long-on but couldn't get under the ball completely and the long-on takes a good overhead catch tumbling on his back

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das lbw b Jarvis 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: raps the pad straight away! Huge shout for lbw, given, but this seemed like it was heading down leg. Review promptly taken. Full, angling in, tries to flick and the ball misses the inside edge. Nothing on Ultra Edge. Umpire's call.. Clipping outside of leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Tiripano b H Masakadza 117 (92b 9x4 6x6) SR: 127.17

dismissalComment.html: ah, Kayes has holed out.. looking for the glorious finish. Wasn't needed but he was set and looking for a big hit or two. Advances down the ground and carts this over mid-off but as he does so the bat turns in his hands and the ball settles into the hands of long-off

milestones.description: Imrul Kayes and Soumya Sarkar's 220-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 2nd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 207 between Shakib and Tamim Iqbal

stories.title: Williams frustrated by Zimbabwe's string of losses
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Sean Williams frustrated by Zimbabwe's string of losses
stories.summary: Zimbabwe have not won a game since March, and their last three one-day series against Pakistan, South Africa and Bangladesh have all resulted in whitewashes

image.caption: Sean Williams celebrates his century
image.longCaption: Sean Williams celebrates his century, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, October 26, 2018

stories.title: Top-order trio give Bangladesh a good selection problem
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Top-order trio give Bangladesh a good selection problem
stories.summary: Neil McKenzie has called for more consistency among Bangladesh's batsmen after impressive hundreds from Imrul Kayes and Soumya Sarkar

image.caption: Soumya Sarkar works one on the off side
image.longCaption: Soumya Sarkar works one on the off side, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, October 26, 2018

stories.title: Imrul, Soumya centuries seal 3-0 sweep
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: The duo helped mow down a 287-run target with 47 balls to spare, after Sean Williams' century had given Zimbabwe a fighting chance

image.caption: Sean Williams plays into the leg side
image.longCaption: Sean Williams plays into the leg side, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong, October 26, 2018

stories.title: Zimbabwe seek favourable end to rough month
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe seek favourable end to rough month
stories.summary: Sitting on a 12-match losing streak, including clean sweeps at the hands of Pakistan and South Africa, the visiting team will be keen to prove its worth ahead of the Tests
